definition: to spoil things through excessive enthusiasm (idiom)
to pull up/to pull out/to draw out by suction/to select/to pick/to stand out (above level)/to surpass/to seize
Hmong or Miao ethnic group of southwest China/surname Miao
sprout
to help/to assist
length/long/forever/always/constantly
chief/head/elder/to grow/to develop/to increase/to enhance

sentences.english: To educate the young generation in such a way is just like making the rice shoots grow by pulling them up.
sentences.chinese: 用这种方法教育下一代无异于拔苗助长。

sentences.english: Let your ideas cook in May, and don't rush the process by calling or adding subtle pressure.
sentences.chinese: 让你的好主意在5月萌芽，不要施加压力拔苗助长。

sentences.english: Teaching children in this way simply means applying too much pressure and damaging them.
sentences.chinese: 用这种方法教育孩子，简直是拔苗助长。

sentences.english: Grass grows in its own time but if you keep pulling it, it will just die.
sentences.chinese: 草会自己生长，如果拔苗助长，它便会死去。

sentences.english: But it's important not to rush things to avoid setbacks.
sentences.chinese: 为了防止复发，拔苗助长是绝对不可以的。

sentences.english: I believe he has the talent – the problem is not to hurry him too much.
sentences.chinese: 我相信他有能力，问题是不要拔苗助长。

definition: see 拔苗助長|拔苗助长[ba2 miao2 zhu4 zhang3]
anxious for quick results (idiom); to demand instant success/impatient for result/impetuous
seeking instant benefit (idiom); shortsighted vision, looking only for fast return
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/don't try to run before you can walk
to neglect the root and pursue the tip (idiom)/to neglect fundamentals and concentrate on details
to act with undue haste (idiom); eager and impatient/overhasty
lit. to kill the chicken to get the eggs (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. to want sth in haste, but cannot get there (idiom, from Analects); more haste, less speed/also written 欲速則不達|欲速则不达
to let sb do whatever they want/to indulge/to give free reins to/to let things slide/to drift aimlessly/laissez-faire
to produce the opposite of the desired result
to copy the way they walk in Handan (idiom)/slavishly copying others, one risks becoming a caricature
lit. to want to get fat with only one mouthful (proverb)/fig. to try to achieve one's goal in the shortest time possible/to be impatient for success
pinyin: yi1 kou3 chi1 ge5 pang4 zi5

definition: too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
lit. to drain the pond to get at the fish (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
lit. not eating for fear of choking (idiom); fig. to cut off one's nose to spite one's face/to avoid sth essential because of a slight risk
in sequence, step by step (idiom); to make steady progress incrementally
